bibl.title: A Mummy Portrait of Antinous from Thebes.
bibl.note: Fragment of a portrait found in the uppermost layer of debris in the open court (Lichthof) of Theban Tomb 196, Object No. P72 052. Greek inscription giving the name, the profession (ναύκληρος) and the lifetime of the person. Possibly before AD 212.

bibl.title: Portraits and Masks. Burial Customs in Roman Egypt

bibl.seg: GRAEFE E., A Mummy Portrait of Antinous from Thebes.
Morris L. BIERBRIER (Ed.), Portraits and Masks. Burial Customs in Roman Egypt (London, 1997) p. 54 et pl. 5, 2.

Fragment of a portrait found in the uppermost layer of debris in the open court (Lichthof) of Theban Tomb 196, Object No. P72 052. Greek inscription giving the name, the profession (ναύκληρος) and the lifetime of the person. Possibly before AD 212.
